abstract: Payment for most of the £2 billion annual banks levy announced by Chancellor George Osborne in his budget Tuesday will fall to the largest British lenders, while building societies and overseas institutions will pay for as little of a quarter of the tax, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: Payment for most of the £2 billion annual banks levy announced by Chancellor George Osborne in his budget Tuesday will fall to the largest British lenders, while building societies and overseas institutions will pay for as little of a quarter of t...
lead_paragraph: Payment for most of the £2 billion ($3 billion) annual bank levy announced by Chancellor George Osborne in his budget Tuesday will fall to the largest British lenders, while building societies and overseas institutions will pay for as little of a quarter of the tax, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Large British Banks Said to Bear Brunt of New Levy

abstract: As the battle lines on the future of for-profit colleges were being drawn Wednesday, one source of contention was the planned appearance at the Congressional hearings on the issue of Steven Eisman, a hedge fund manager known for having predicted the housing market crash.
snippet: As the battle lines on the future of for-profit colleges were being drawn Wednesday, one source of contention was the planned appearance at the Congressional hearings on the issue of Steven Eisman, a hedge fund manager known for having predicted t...
lead_paragraph: The battle lines on the future of for-profit colleges were being drawn Wednesday, a day before a series of Congressional hearings on the issue were to begin.

headline.main: Fund Manager Battles Over For-Profit Colleges

abstract: A lawsuit filed against AT&T and Apple over the elimination of the iPad 3G unlimited data plan was amended and refiled as a class action lawsuit on Wednesday in a California district court.
snippet: A lawsuit filed against AT&T and Apple over the elimination of the iPad 3G unlimited data plan was amended and refiled as a class action lawsuit on Wednesday in a California district court.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed on June 9 against Apple and AT&T over the discontinued unlimited-data plan for the iPad 3G has been amended and re-filed to include additional iPad 3G customers.

headline.main: Class Action Against Apple and AT&T Is Amended
